page.title: 09RUSHALL HALL
page.content: The first Hall at Rushall was built in the twelth century. The walls were built in 1429 and resemble castle battlements. The gatehouse has been restored by the present owners. The winding stone steps in the tower are steep and slippery. During the civil war cannon balls were fired at the Hall, and they are now on the mantlepiece in the Hall. There is a priest's hiding place behind the panelling in one of the rooms. In the garden there is a Saxon burial mound which contains bones and coins. The families of Leigh, Harpur, Mellish and Buchanan lived in the Hall and local roads are named after them.
